column2: This character is a human. Many years ago, when the Titans left Azeroth, the old gods sent the Curse of the Flesh to the Titans' countless creations. The curse failed to bring them under the old gods' sway, but the vrykul - gloomy, cruel, and warlike giants of the north - were created to protect other servants of the Titans. Because of the curse, Vrykul women began to give birth to weak, ugly children. King Imiron, the ruler of the whole Vrykul people, found out about this and believed that the Titans turned away from his people. Thus, he renounced the creators, ordering the killing of the "spoiled" offspring - but not all mothers fulfilled the king's decree. Those who could not do this fled to the south, and their children became the ancestors of man. Humans are one of the youngest races in Azeroth, but they have already withstood many trials with honour. Proud and unbending, humans are diverse and capable of any job, but are most skilled at diplomacy and solving problems peacefully.

Gnolls are cunning, animal-like folk - a hybrid of man with hyena. A big hump, a long neck, and clumsy fingers do not stop them from fighting, and conflict itself is a way of life for this race. Gnolls are very violent creatures, even over the smallest dispute, they are liable to gnaw at each other's throats - and in a literal sense, as they devour all creatures, including members of their own race. In their society, the Cult of Power flourishes. Tribal leaders are among the strongest, while the weak are consumed. Gnolls are lazy and primitive, as they have not yet mastered metalworking and still prefer a nomadic way of life.

Murlocs are a strange combination of humanoid and fish, an ancient two-legged race of amphibians. They live along the coasts and within the depts of oceans, the coasts of lakes and rivers, as well as in underwater ruins. Murlocs are capable of breathing on land, although they rarely risk moving too far from water. Their hunched appearance is rather awkward, but don't let this mislead you - some murlocs travel overland with great speed and agility. Murlocs do not care about individuality or creativity, as this does not help the survival of the tribe or most of their race. They value obedience above all else. Agility and cruelty are also important to them, reflected in their hunting skills and strength.

Trolls are an ancient race, as mysterious as they are dangerous. Their numerous tribes inhabit every corner of the world. They have been at the center of a racial war with the men, dwarves, and elves of Azeroth since the beginning of their chronicles. All trolls have impressive physical regeneration, they may be cured of serious wounds and even restore lost limbs. They are larger than the average human. The colour of their skin ranges in a great variety, from light green and blue to dark gray. They are agile, cunning, and completely ruthless when they hunt their prey - no matter whether this prey is a wild animal or a sentient being. Undoubtedly, angering trolls or considering them primitive and stupid is a serious mistake.

Ogres are tall and fat humanoids with huge arms and a large belly. They are extremely strong and love to demonstrate this fact. In battle, they are charging with a loud cry, most often wielding a giant club. Few can hold their own against an enraged ogre, and taking one down is even more difficult. The strongest warrior leads the tribe: no ogre questions the rule of the strongest. However, if the leader shows signs of weakness another ogre can challenge the chieftain in order to usurp his place. Although there are those in their society who are capable of mystical arts, the majority of ogres do not share this pursuit, for they are not particularly intelligent. A rare offshoot of the ogre race has two heads instead of one. The second head is almost always one-eyed, and, unfortunately, as stupid as the other head: the heads can conflict and even fight eachother.

Wild cinnamon or green-skinned orcs - natives of Draenor, who have recently arrived in Azeroth. Orc men are massive and horrific looking creatures, while most orc women are slightly shorter than most human men (and some of them are of the same height). Orcs have broad shoulders and muscular, strong bodies. To their enemies, they are beasts and fearsome opponents, unparalleled in their ferocity and cunning. But to their allies, orcs are noble and generous. For an orc, skill in battle brings great honour. Honour is the basic concept that lies in at the heart of the orc society, a concept that has driven their race to unite before great threats. Orcs seem quick-tempered, but they are honoured by the wisdom of their leaders and their shamans.

The Lord of Fire is an incredibly strong ruler of fire elementals, and one of the four Elemental Lords. His plane is the Firelands, the realm of fire and ash, lying deep beneath the earth and the ocean within the realm of the elements.
Knight of the Brotherhood of the Horse

The Brotherhood of the Horse is an ancient order of the knights from the kingdom of Stormwind. It has existed since the man migrated from Strom, now known as the Arathi Highlands. Members of the brotherhood are the strongest soldiers in the azerothian military: among their ranks are the greatest and most famous knights and warriors of Stormwind, who are always ready to sacrifice their lives for the good of their homeland.

The Shadow Council is an organisation of warlocks from mortal peoples, which stands in the service of the demons of the Burning Legion. The Shadow Council was created by Gul'dan while he was still on Draenor, when the united clans of orcs began a war against the Draenei. The initial objectives of the council was to ensure stability in the war, which the Horde began against the Draenei, through the political manipulation of clans and the spread of sorcerous magic. With the invasion of the Horde into Azeroth, the Shadow Council has significantly expanded its sphere of influence not only inside the Horde, but also beyond its borders, by launching its networks to all corners of the known world.

The Guardian of Tirisfal is a mortal champion selected by the Council of Tirisfal - a secret organisation including mages of humans, gnomes, and high elves - endowed with great magical powers to fight against the Burning Legion. When the Guardian grows old or gets tired of the endless fight against the chaos, the council selects a new guardian and gives him the power of his predecessor. For each generation, there is only one guardian, but due to his enormous magical power, he is able to fight against all demons invading Azeroth.

Tinkers are one of the most intellectually developed types of azerothian adventurers. They are the creators of incredible inventions, from insane multi-purpose knives to chainsaws and steam tanks. Their inventions allow them to overcome almost any trouble they may face. And yet, despite all their help to society, engineers possess poor reputations as dangerous outcasts - mainly because of endless goblin experiments with explosives.

Explorers are those brave souls who risk their lives for the sake of science and the expansion of the common store of knowledge for all inhabitants of Azeroth. They may also be scientists studying the societies of past centuries and travelers who provide a description of new territories and erase the void from maps of Azeroth.

The naga little resemble the nobility they once were. Their proud appearance has been warped and distorted, many of them received a number of special changes characteristical of the sea depths, such as an ability to release ink, tentacles, sharp scales, poisonous fangs, strong shells of mollusks, serpents instead of hair, large and sharp dorsal fins, and strong tails. In ancient times a matriarchy was established, when the witches and sirens developed stronger intellect and magical capabilities to control the entire community of naga. Males, who lost most of their magical powers during their transformation, acquired inhuman physical strength, and now constitute the main strike force of naga armies. In general, their exile has only strengthened the evil, vicious nature of these naked and sadistic creatures.

The blood elves are a race formed from the high elves of Quel'thalas. In honour of their dead brethren, the survivors call themselves blood elves or Sin'dorei, which in thalassian means "children of blood". Both high elves and blood elves, regardless of class, status or origin, are fond of magic and have some addiction to it. But, unlike their original Quel'dorei brethren, all Sin'dorei siphon away the magical power off other beings. On average, blood elves are slightly taller than humans and considerably thinner in bone structure. Most of them have chiseled, regular features. The Quel'dorei heritage is expressed in light skin and golden hue of hair, although among the Sin'dorei, there are elves with unnaturally pale or unexpectedly swarthy complexions.

The high elves, or Quel'dorei, are the absolute opposite of their cousins - the night elves (or Kaldorei). The Quel'Dorei are the descendants of those who served Azshara at the time of the first Well of Eternity, they took the light of the sun and left the darkness of the night. High elves are typically taller and more slender than humans. They are distinguished from the night elves by shorter ears and much smaller growth, among other physical differences. Quel'Dorei have fair skin, thin, and perfectly fair facial features - many of them are regarded as beautiful. However, despite their external beauty, high elves are quite narcissistic. The high elves used magic for generations, absorbing it with their mothers' milk. Even among those lacking a natural talent for magic, high elves cannot live or even think clearly if they do not receive their necessary mana requirement on a regular basis.

Gnomes are a tiny race of technicians, mechanics, and inventors, known for their ingenious minds and eccentric character. Gnomes are very small - child-size - hardly more than a meter in height, and weigh only about twenty kilograms. Despite their small growth, they are quick and clever. For their small body, they have a disproportionately large head, almost the size of the rest of the body. Within these oversized skulls, all gnomes have the mind of a genius: the desire for invention, especially complex mechanical devices, is inlaid by nature, although some of these inventions are very dangerous.

Dwarfs are small and stocky creatures that most often live in the mountains of Khaz Modan, the central part of the continent of the Eastern Kingdoms. Due to their physical attributes, they have excellent strength and endurance. A usual dwarf is stable, observant, and always ready for work or battle. He can be violent and angry or stubborn and persistent, depending on the situation. Although dwarves prefer to plan their actions in advance to overcome trouble, many of them will lose their temper when their feelings come into play. Many generations of dwarves are famous for their unsurpassed skill in working on metal and stone. They are masters of blacksmithing, and their jewelry, armor, and weapons are made perfectly.

Kobolds are a cowardly race of miners and candle manufacturers who resemble large and lean anthropoid rats, spending most of their life underground. The kobolds have a rather obsessive mindset of mining ores and digging tunnels - they grab any abandoned mine and pick up any tools remaining there, at least whenever they have a chance to do so with impunity. Of all the ores that can be mined in the earth, they are especially fond of gold. It seems that their race lives in darkness for the most part - but that's not the case. The kobolds in the mines rely on the light of their candles, which they wear directly on their heads and zealously guard against the hands of others.
This character is a member of the paladin order of the Silver Hand.

This character is a small and cute bunny.
The Aspect of Death was once known as the Aspect of Earth, who has been chosen by Khaz'goroth and given dominion over the earth and the deep places of the world, but darkness swallowed aspect's soul.

This is my gift: compassion for all living things. A drive to protect and nurture them. And the ability to heal that which others cannot, birth what others may not, and love even the unlovable--who surely need such grace more than any other souls. \n- Eonar the Life-Binder

The literal meaning of undead is simple - a creature or person risen from death. The undoing of death, hence undead. While they vary in size, shape, and form, the most common undead are those who have risen from their own (or other's) accord, who maintain their sanity and memories from life. This character in question is a textbook undead, and may act differently from every other undead creature due to their own autonomy.

Men who have finally been given the grace of undeath are known as ghouls. Varying in size, shape, and form, ghouls are the shocktroopers of every undead mass. Using speed as their advantage in battle, these charging hulks of fallen warriors are every shieldbearer's worst nightmare.
This character is an incorporeal spirt.
This person has been destined to rule since birth, with extraordinary gifts that will help him or her reach this destiny.
This wealthy landowner has distinguished his or herself in many courts, making a name for him or herself as a fount of wit and logic.
While this person may or may not have a complete education, they are of average ability when it comes to court duties.
Of little importance, evil, or just plain uneducated in the way of ruling, this person is known to be of poor ability in the way of politics.
This person has nearly fully honed their ingenuity with mechanical systems.
By spending a little more time creating new inventions and innovating with already existing ones, this person has taken some time to hone their mechanical genius.
This person is relatively new to the art of engineering. Either inventing or innovating, they seem to keep to themselves when engaged with their projects.

The soul of a single dark, necromantic being imprisoned within a suit of armour and a crown, the Lich King intends to turn the whole world black. This soul was once known as Ner'zhul, the dreaded lapdog of the Burning Legion, and was under the command of Kil'jaeden. His soul was cast into Icecrown Glacier to raise an undead army to harass and weaken Azeroth for an upcoming invasion. However, Kil'jaeden's plan failed, and Ner'zhul would go on to begin his own faction to bring Azeroth under his heel - the Scourge.
This character is a sorcerer. It has a natural talent for magic.
This character is a fel orc.

This character is a demon. Demons are immortal beings linked to the Twisting Nether. Most of them feed upon magic and life, and delight in inflicting suffering, spreading corruption, and destroying all that is good.

The Arakkoa are an intelligent and bipedal androgynous race that once maintained a large empire known as Apexis, centred in the southern-most parts of lands now known as Skettis. After the fall of Apexis and the rise of the Horde, this race has grown near-extinct. It has seen better days, as many are being transformed into the widespread hunchback and broken outcasts in Outland.

The cursed branch of the Arakkoa are known as outcasts. They are hunchbacked and disgusting in appearance when compared to their sleek, upright counterparts. The cause of their demise is their experimentation with - and failure to control - shadow magic, which the cursed arakkoa still use despite their failed manipulations. As one might expect, due to their obsessive use of shadow magic, shadow itself has practically been imbedded into their culture, making them more secretive. The use of ciphers and illusion magic are widespread within this sect of Arakkoa.

The Nathrezim are more popularly known in common as dreadlords. Children of the Twisting Nether, these intelligent and cunning emissaries of the Burning Legion are the brainchild of its daemonic forces. The appearance of a nathrezim is reflective of their name in common - vampiric, dreadful, and life-consuming. They utilize terror and subterfuge in nearly every political mortal dispute, using illusion and literal possession of mortals to further their goals.

Man'ari, or unnatural beings, are Eredar who have accepted powers bestowed upon them by Sargeras, and they have become the leading demon race of the Burning Legion. They are supremely talented magic-users and they originate from the world of Argus, now a Legion world. The Man'ari share an ancient ancestry with those who denied the gift of the Legion, the Draenei, or exiled ones.

Ered'ruin are bulky demonic creatures, more known as doomguards. They are one of the strongest fighting units of the Burning Legion. The power of these demons was so impressive that Archimonde, one of the Eredar leaders, made this race his personal guard.

Demons who are killed within the mortal world are sent to the Twisting Nether, a plane for immortal beings. Demons are trapped within stasis before they are summoned into the mortal world. There is no hierarchy or name for demons in the Twisting Nether - they only go by their merit, which may or may not be needed by their dominant fel masters.

Chosen and knighted by a figure of many names. The Lord of Icecrown, Jailer of the Damned, the Dark One, and the Prince of Darkness. He has made this character his chosen to further his plans and spread his will across Azeroth. Many will fall, shiver at his namesake, and will soon serve under him and his chosen in death.

Those that ascend into high tiers of necromantic magic sacrifice themselves for unspeakable unholy power. These people are known as liches, who take on the form of ethereal, skeletal beings which hover off of the ground, commanding thralls and undead armies. Liches can be independent, or servants to the Prince of Darkness.

Made from the skin, bones, and organs of victims of the undead, abominations are hulking, ogre-sized individuals who stop at nothing to kill and mutilate victims, so that they may be risen into ghouls... or worse, be part of the abomination's diet. Despite being dull-witted and smelling as if it bathed in feces and vomit, these monsters are not to be underestimated - they have the capability to be as large as the vrykul.

The latest and most dangerous of the Lich King's experiments, the plague eruptor is the abomination's ugly step-sister. They are violent, strong, fast-moving corpses of patchwork design which have been pumped full of the undead plague.

Zombie-like in nature with ghoul-like attitudes, the wight is an odd creation. Depicted to have flat heads and bolts implanted in their temples, these creatures seem to have an impressive intelligence. Some wights even have the capability to retain their sanity after the transformation to undeath.

Banshees are incorporeal undead elf women, known for their unholy screams and the unsettling ability to possess the bodies of their enemies. Even though the ability to interact with the physical world is very limited, banshee remains an extremely dangerous enemy.

Bone golems are modified versions of ghouls and skeletons: their arms are replaced with deadly scythes, beasts risen and fueled by the ichor of undeath. These golems are products of the scourge, which is unsurprising due to their horrific design.
This character is a frost giant.

This character is a sayaad. The sayaad revel in causing anguish, and serving the Burning Legion by conducting nightmarish interrogations. Creatures of incredible mental powers, they can lull those of weak minds into their servitude. The Sayaad know much about love, lust and sensitive coupling.

Shadow priests are adept with shadow magic, and they use the powers of the void to inflict pain and madness upon their victims. They are able to deform the mind and body and bring agony to their enemies.

Shadow priests are adept with shadow magic, and they use the powers of the void to inflict pain and madness upon their victims. They are able to deform the mind and body and bring agony to their enemies.

Shadow priests are adept with shadow magic, and they use the powers of the void to inflict pain and madness upon their victims. They are able to deform the mind and body and bring agony to their enemies.

One of this character's arms is turned into a long slimy tentacle by magic of the old gods.
Under the influence of the Old Gods, one of the hands of this character transformed into the huge claw.
Under the influence of the Old Gods, the body of this character has covered with the chitinious growths.
Under the influence of the Old Gods, sharp chitinious spikes grown from the body of this characted.
Under the influence of the Old Gods, the body of this character has covered with slimy scale in some places.
Under the influence of the Old Gods the body of this character has covered with frighten eyes.

This character is n'raqi. N'raqi, of the faceless ones, are a monstrous race that arose from the organic matter that seeped from the Old Gods' blighted forms during the primordial era of Azeroth. N'raqi are very insidious and cruel, their uncanny forms, resembling something between a mollusk and an insect, can plunge into shock every mortal creature.

This character is C'Thrax. C'Thraxxi are monstrous warbringers far larger and more resilient than other lesser faceless ones. These tremendous horrific creatures are even able to control minions of their Lords when they need it.
This character is a dark shaman: one of those who enslaved and corrupted the elements with power of the void or Fel magic.
This character is in a deep sleep.
This character has been affected by the worgen curse.
This character has lost its mind in the abyss of animal rage and guilt.
This character is a night elf.
This lich has lost its corporeal body and now waiting for it regeneration.

Dragon whelps are the smallest member of the dragonkin species, representing the offspring of a brood. As a result, they are easily the weakest variation of dragons. In most cases, however, where there are whelps, their larger cousins are close by.\n\nRed dragons once ruled as lords over all dragonkind. This nobility is reflected in every aspect of a red dragon, from its proud demeanor to its aura - one that inspires awe. It is as debilitating as the terrifying presence that other dragons possess, except that it overwhelms with a beatific aura. Red dragons exemplify the serenity of life and nature. Legends hold that the earth is renewed wherever a red dragon walks upon the earth or burns the soil with its flaming breath. Although they use fire to protect and punish, the flames always give way to new life.

Drakes are dragons that are still relatively young in comparison to their ancient brethren.\n\nRed dragons once ruled as lords over all dragonkind. This nobility is reflected in every aspect of a red dragon, from its proud demeanor to its aura - one that inspires awe. It is as debilitating as the terrifying presence that other dragons possess, except that it overwhelms with a beatific aura. Red dragons exemplify the serenity of life and nature. Legends hold that the earth is renewed wherever a red dragon walks upon the earth or burns the soil with its flaming breath. Although they use fire to protect and punish, the flames always give way to new life.

Dragon is both the name for the race as a whole and the short title for the mature-aged dragon.\n\nRed dragons once ruled as lords over all dragonkind. This nobility is reflected in every aspect of a red dragon, from its proud demeanor to its aura - one that inspires awe. It is as debilitating as the terrifying presence that other dragons possess, except that it overwhelms with a beatific aura. Red dragons exemplify the serenity of life and nature. Legends hold that the earth is renewed wherever a red dragon walks upon the earth or burns the soil with its flaming breath. Although they use fire to protect and punish, the flames always give way to new life.

Wyrm is the elder stage of the dragon life cycle.\n\nRed dragons once ruled as lords over all dragonkind. This nobility is reflected in every aspect of a red dragon, from its proud demeanor to its aura - one that inspires awe. It is as debilitating as the terrifying presence that other dragons possess, except that it overwhelms with a beatific aura. Red dragons exemplify the serenity of life and nature. Legends hold that the earth is renewed wherever a red dragon walks upon the earth or burns the soil with its flaming breath. Although they use fire to protect and punish, the flames always give way to new life.

Dragon whelps are the smallest member of the dragonkin species, representing the offspring of a brood. As a result, they are easily the weakest variation of dragons. In most cases however, where there are whelps, their larger cousins are close by.\n\nBlue dragons are regal creatures, their posture and facial expressions expressing wisdom and intellect. They are creatures of ice and water, often found in cold regions and preferring to keep to themselves. They are studious, enjoying both literature and scholarly texts, and study any bit of knowledge or trivia that they come across. These dragons are best known for altering their forms and integrating into other societies in order to learn new technologies, spells, and crafts. Blue dragons are peaceful creatures, but very territorial. Once a blue dragon has claimed a certain territory, woe to any - even dragons of their own flight - who enter into that area without permission. The mighty dragon bursts from the frigid waters, its muscular form covered in glistening scales. It has patterned cobalt markings across its neck and upper body, and its wings fold almost invisibly against its sinuous body.

Dragon whelps are the smallest member of the dragonkin species, representing the offspring of a brood. As a result, they are easily the weakest variation of dragons. In most cases however, where there are whelps, their larger cousins are close by.\n\nGreen dragons are rare creatures, not often seen on the physical plane. They are creatures of dream and make their home on the plane of the Emerald Dream. This plane is not just a place of dream crafting, but an immense verdant realm of unspoiled paradise. Other flights often call greens "brothers and sisters of dream" in respect to the realm from which they hail. The dragon has translucent, jewel-like scales that shine with a faint green light. Its eyes are glowing orbs of green-gold light, with no pupils or irises. Its sinuous and shining form flies through the air as if swimming through water. Green dragons have no enemies in the Emerald Dream, but they know that the world of Azeroth is not as lucky or as peaceful. They are capable of fighting, but choose not to if there is any option other than their own death. If conflict is unavoidable, they try to neutralize foes with their breath and leave the area. Some consider green dragons to be pacifists or weaklings. Those who have roused a green to combat fast learn the error of this opinion. After all, dreams and nightmares are not so very different.

Dragon whelps are the smallest member of the dragonkin species, representing the offspring of a brood. As a result, they are easily the weakest variation of dragons. In most cases however, where there are whelps, their larger cousins are close by.\n\nBlack dragons are large creatures that are carnivorous. They spend their time hunting, as well as watching the various wars around the world, and can often be found torturing prisoners, animals, or anything else unfortunate enough to fall into their care. A black dragon is a large, thickly-built creature with a massive chest and a long, sinuous neck. Its hide is a rich, lustrous black with large scales that are supple yet hard as rock. A crest made of peaked bone spikes runs from its head and down its back, and bristles when the great beast grows angry. Its fangs shine a coppery-red, and deep inside its mouth a constant sulpurous light emits a faint glow. Most civilized races say that black dragons have a cruel, callous look to their serpentine faces. Black dragons do not shed individual scales, but rather molt once a year, usually by spending a week resting within a lava flow of an active volcano, which peels off and consumes their discarded skin. The skin of a black dragon nearing its molt grows dull and grey. Most black dragons appear with their horns and wings in a shade of orange to brown, but a few females appear with purplish wings and horns.

Drakes are dragons that are still relatively young in comparison to their ancient brethren.\n\nBlack dragons are large creatures that are carnivorous. Dragon whelps are the smallest member of the dragonkin species, representing the offspring of a brood. As a result, they are easily the weakest variation of dragons. In most cases however, where there are whelps, their larger cousins are close by.\n\nBronze dragons are smaller and more agile than dragons of the other flights, and they appear to be built for speed rather than stamina. Their bodies are thin and dexterous, with scales almost metallic in appearance. The quality of their scales is such that they are sometimes mistaken for constructs or detailed statuary. Bronze dragons are fastidious, keeping their mesh-like scales clean and shining at all times. The dragon is long and slender, its scales glinting with a metallic sheen. A spiky bone ridge runs down its back and forms a wicked point at the end of its tail. Its form shimmers from golden yellow to rich orange in the sunlight as it darts through the air. Bronze dragons prefer to use their spell-like abilities and breath weapon to confuse and scatter enemies. Afterward, they approach foes singly, swooping from the air or fighting on the ground depending on which approach offers the best tactical advantage. Bronzes can also be very patient, watching from afar until a target lets down its guard.

This character is a leader of the Horde. For the Horde!
This character is a leader of the Alliance. For the Alliance!
This character is a flamewaker. Flamewakers are a race of ruthless serpentine creatures that serve Ragnaros, the Firelord.

This character is a tauren. Taurens are a race of large, bovine humanoids who dwell in the great plains of central Kalimdor. For countless generations, they were constantly harassed by the violent centaurs, who forced the tauren into a nomadic lifestyle in the harsh Barrens.

This character is a centaur. Centaurs are a half-humanoid, half-horse, war-like tribal race. They abound in central and southern Kalimdor, primarily in Desolace and the Barrens, where they engage in constant war against other centaur and tauren tribes. They are savagery and brutality incarnate.

This character is a quilboar. Quilboars are a race of aggressive, primitive, boar-like humanoids native to Kalimdor and Kul'Tiras. They have razor sharp spikes protruding from their muscular, hunched backs. These resilient, fearless creatures inhabit the central Barrens of Kalimdor in the labyrinthine maze of thorns called Razorfen Downs.

This character is a tol'vir. The tol'vir are a race of cat-like humanoids found in Uldum. Originally, they were stone constructs created by the titans to maintain lore repositories and machinery surrounding that area, as well as the city of Ulduar. They possess cat-like lower bodies and heads and human torsos. Like many other titan-forged, the tol'vir succumbed to the Curse of Flesh.
This character is a qiraji. Qiraji is a race of insectoid creatures based in southern Silithus.

This character is a satyr. Satyrs are a race of bestial demons. They are created through the spreading of the ancient satyr curse, an affliction which originated with Xavius, a highborne sorcerer who was destroyed and remade into a demonic form as a punishment for his failures by Sargeras during the War of the Ancients. Xavius soon began spreading his cursed form to other night elves and eventually to other races as well.

This character is a wolvar. Wolvars are a primitive race of small, wolverine-like humanoids who inhabit the frozen continent of Northrend. Despite their smaller stature, the wolvar are some of the most aggressive creatures in Northrend. This often makes their curious nature intimidating.
This character is a tuskarr. Tuskarr are a peaceful humanoid walrus-like people indigenous to the cold shores of Northrend.

This character is a gorloc. Gorlocs are an arctic race of murloc-like creatures. They are allegedly the next evolution of murloc, but murlocs apparently evolved from gorlocs, not the other way around. If they have a progenitor ancient, it was frog-based.
This character is a furbolg. Furbolgs are a hulking, ancient race of bear-men who live in northern Kalimdor and in Northrend.

This character is a vrykul. Vrykuls are a race of fearsome half-giant warriors native to the Howling Fjord, located in southeastern Northrend. They are the progenitors of the human race, who were originally vrykul offspring that were born weak and deformed as a result of the Curse of Flesh.
This character is a kvaldir. Kvaldirs are the spirits of fearsome vrykul warriors or seafaring raiders who roam the seas raiding ships and coastal settlements.
This character is a taunka. Taunkas are an ancient offshoot of the yaungol and relatives to the tauren who have adapted to the harsh environment in Northrend.

This character is a harpy. Harpies are vicious, flying creatures that resemble a cross between a night elf and a hunting bird, with long talons for feet and large graceful wings for arms. They destroy the environments in which they settle, killing every creature they encounter and despoiling the land to build nests noted for their noxious odor. Harpies originally hail from the Stonetalon Mountains, but have since spread out across Kalimdor, Northrend, and the Broken Isles.

This character is a magnataur. Magnataur are massive creatures that live in Northrend. They have the torso of a giant attached to the body of a mammoth. Like the centaur and Keepers of the Grove, they are relatives of the demigod Cenarius. They are notoriously long-lived, though lacking in patience, and are rumored to engage in cannibalism when food is scarce. They are vicious, brutal, and uncaring. Only the strongest and meanest survive.

You are bound to the waking Dream of Creation. Nature is your realm, and all things have caught glimpses of the Emerald Dream when they sleep. You see them all, Ysera. And they see you, though they may not know it. Like the Life-Binder, you touch all living beings, and sing to them the songs of creation and interconnectedness. \n- Eonar the Life-Binder

I believe that you will find that my gift to you is not just a profound duty--which it is--but also a delight--which it is! Magic must be regulated, managed, and controlled. But it must also be appreciated and valued and not hoarded. Such is the contradiction you must deal with. May you be dutiful...and joyous both. \n- Norgannon the Dreamweaver

Unto you is charged the great task of keeping the purity of time. Know that there is only one true timeline, though there are those who would have it otherwise. You must protect it. Without the truth of time as it is meant to unfold, more will be lost than you can possibly imagine. The fabric of reality will unravel. It is a heavy task--the base of all tasks of this world, for nothing can transpire without time. \n- Aman'Thul the Highfather
This character is currently in the Emerald Dream.

The Priestesses of Elune compose the elite ranks of the Kaldorei clergy. They are often phenomenal leaders, combatants, and healers. Guided by the Moon Goddess of the Kaldorei, Elune, the will of Her Priestess is unwavering.
This character can not marry because of its race or because it couldn't find its soul mate.

The Dryads and Keepers of the Grove are collectively known as the Children of Cenarius, as the name implies they are descended from the demigod Cenarius. Like their parent, they possess a natural aptitude for nature magic. They use their powers to protect the wilds and while they are wary of intruders they are generally kind and welcoming to those with no ill intent. But they will without hesitation give their lives to protect nature from those that would defile it.

This character is a Highborne Night elf. During the time of the ancient Kaldorei empire these elves were the ruling class of the great empire. Today however, they are mistrusted and generally blamed for ruining the world by summoning the Legion. Unlike the Kaldorei, the Highborne continue to use Arcane magic freely during their daily lives and are subject to the same addiction and withdrawal as High elves.

The Frost Nymphs are an offshoot of the Dryads that primarily live in cold regions. They are able to use cold elemental magic alongside nature magic. Like their temperate cousins, they are dedicated to protecting nature and the land where they reside.

Dragon whelps are the smallest member of the dragonkin species, representing the offspring of a brood. As a result, they are easily the weakest variation of dragons. In most cases however, where there are whelps, their larger cousins are close by.\n\nInfinite dragons are a mysterious corrupted Dragonflight that has only recently begun to appear. Like the Bronze flight they are capable of time traveling, but unlike the Bronze flight they have no qualms about altering historical events, and the two are often opposing each other. In terms of size and scale, the Bronze and the Infinites are almost identical, but the Infinites are easy to distinguish from the Bronze due to their dark grey color, the strange white glow underneath their scales, and how it appears that their scales are falling off in large flakes only to dissipate and appear once more on the Dragon's body.

Drakes are dragons that are still relatively young in comparison to their ancient brethren.\n\nInfinite dragons are a mysterious corrupted Dragonflight that has only recently begun to appear. Like the Bronze flight they are capable of time traveling, but unlike the Bronze flight they have no qualms about altering historical events, and the two are often opposing each other. In terms of size and scale, the Bronze and the Infinites are almost identical, but the Infinites are easy to distinguish from the Bronze due to their dark grey color, the strange white glow underneath their scales, and how it appears that their scales are falling off in large flakes only to dissipate and appear once more on the Dragon's body.

Dragon is both the name for the race as a whole and the short title for the mature-aged dragon.\n\nInfinite dragons a mysterious corrupted Dragonflight that has only recently begun to appear. Like the Bronze flight they are capable of time traveling, but unlike the Bronze flight they have no qualms about altering historical events, and the two are often opposing each other. In terms of size and scale, the Bronze and the Infinites are almost identical, but the Infinites are easy to distinguish from the Bronze due to their dark grey color, the strange white glow underneath their scales, and how it appears that their scales are falling off in large flakes only to dissipate and appear once more on the Dragon's body.

Wyrm is the elder stage of the dragon life cycle.\n\nInfinite dragons are a mysterious corrupted Dragonflight that has only recently begun to appear. Like the Bronze flight they are capable of time traveling, but unlike the Bronze flight they have no qualms about altering historical events, and the two are often opposing each other. In terms of size and scale, the Bronze and the Infinites are almost identical, but the Infinites are easy to distinguish from the Bronze due to their dark grey color, the strange white glow underneath their scales, and how it appears that their scales are falling off in large flakes only to dissipate and appear once more on the Dragon's body.

Cenarius, Lord of the Forest and patron of many druids, is one of the most powerful and influential demigods of Azeroth. Worshipped by the night elves since their early history, the Son of Malorne taught the elves to be druids and embrace nature, as opposed to the arcane-inclined Highborne and the religiously-inclined Sisterhood of Elune. He served as a commander of the forces of Kalimdor in the War of the Ancients after the death of his father. He has continued serving as a teacher and protector of the elves and their forests for over 10,000 years.
The Vulpera are a diminuitive race of scavengers primarily living in the dunes of Vol'dun on Zandalar. They are a resourceful and skilled people that can survive in the most harsh conditions.

One of the nine Titan Keepers imbued by members of the Pantheon with their powers, these watchers are responsible for the safeguarding of Azeroth, and they would go on to lead the titan-forged armies against the Black Empire. Many of them are simply thought to be legends, but their impact upon the history and very safety of Azeroth cannot be denied.

Together with the Keeper Tyr, Odyn battled and defeated Ragnaros the Firelord and plotted the downfall of the Old God Yogg-Saron. For his tenacity and leadership in battle against the Black Empire, the Pantheon granted him the role of Prime Designate of Azeroth, making him the leader of the titan-forged, the watcher in charge of Yogg-Saron's imprisonment, and controller of the Forge of Wills.
The Sethrak are a race of serpent people living primarily in the deserts of Vol'dun on Zandalar. They are inteligent and skillful people and they are the descendants of the serpent loa Sethraliss.

The titans are a race of colossal, planet-sized cosmic beings composed of the universe's primordial matter and pure arcane energy. They roam across the cosmos like mobile worlds, capable of the very art of creation itself. Titans used this immense power to find and awaken other titans. Starting with Aman'thul, a Pantheon of titans was formed, their mission being to watch over the universe as bastions and defenders of pure good as they searched for others of their kind.

Dark titans refers to a titan corrupted to antagonize the forces of good. However in this context, a dark titan refers to a titan subjugated by the powers of Fel, whether it be Sargeras the lord of the Burning Legion, or his avatar lieutenant, Aggramar.

The titan watchers are the first generation of the titan-forged. These giant humanoids were divided into the sleek metal Aesir, and the stone Vanir. These two types of watchers held power over storm and the earth, respectively.

Skeletons can be reanimated as undead through magic. While gangly and seemingly frail, skeletons can possess superhuman strength and be highly resistant to most physical attacks. Some have retained their consciousness and intellect, and are capable of attacking with weapons and magic

This character is an observer. Observers are an intelligent race of floating eyeball squids native to the Great Dark Beyond. Looking through the Twisting Nether, observers have the capability to see through forms of stealth and invisibility.
This character is a Mechagnome. Mechagnomes are the clockwork Titanforged ancestors of the Gnomish race, they were created by Mimiron and are as ingenious and creative as their gnomish descendants.
This character is an Earthen. These strong willed rock-shaped people are the ancestors of modern Dwarves, created by the titans a long time ago to shape the very Earth.

This character is a Nerubian. The Nerubians are descendants of the ancient Aqir, after the Troll war, the Aqir who became the Nerubians sought refuge far to the north and built a great underground kingdom. Eventually the Nerubians developed a unique form of architecture alongside a unique culture.

This character is an Iron Dwarf. The Iron Dwarves were created in the Forge of Wills by Loken to serve as his private army. Fanatically loyal to him, the Iron Dwarves seek to scour the enemies of their master and help him realize his designs. The Iron Dwarves possess a metallic body imbued with the power of the storms, making every Iron dwarf a formidable fighter.
This character is a void being. These creatures are full of Shadow energy. Many of them were born far beyond this reality and were able to penetrate Azeroth with the help of the Void Lords.
This character suffers from 'Corrupted Blood', a very contagious disease that turns blood into thick bile. Rumors say that it has been created by a blood god, known as Hakkar.
